title: Is it illegal to print a copy of an out of print book for personal use? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: In Finland and I think in many European countries this is perfectly legal. Students do it with textbooks though they just use a photo copier. Similarly one can loan CD from library and copy or record TV programs. DVD are an exception because of the copy protection. Also computer programs cannot be copied.
How do you think it’s different from simple steeling this book? Neither of people involved in producing this book (author, publisher, editor, corrector, etc.) will receive their money.
